programme.title: Classic F1 Races
programme.desc: A look back at the 1982 Monaco Grand Prix at the Circuit de Monaco. John Watson won the previous race in Belgium, crossing the line ahead of Keke Rosberg and Eddie Cheever.

programme.title: Classic F1 Races
programme.desc: A chance to relive some of the most significant and spectacular moments from the 1983 Formula 1 season. Here's a look at the Monaco Grand Prix from the Circuit de Monaco.

programme.title: Classic F1 Races
programme.desc: A chance to relive some of Ayrton Senna's most significant and spectacular races. Here is the 1984 Monaco Grand Prix at the Circuit de Monaco.

programme.title: Classic F1 Races
programme.desc: A look back at the 1988 Monaco Grand Prix at the Circuit de Monaco. McLaren's Alain Prost topped the Drivers' Championship going into this race.

programme.title: Classic F1 Races
programme.desc: A look back at the 1989 Monaco Grand Prix at the Circuit de Monaco. Ayrton Senna claimed pole position ahead of Alain Prost and Thierry Boutsen.

programme.title: Classic F1 Races
programme.desc: Relive the Monaco Grand Prix of 1992. British racer Nigel Mansell started in pole position but was set for a fierce battle with three-time world champion Ayrton Senna.

programme.title: Classic F1 Races
programme.desc: A chance to relive the 1993 Monaco Grand Prix at the Circuit de Monaco. Alain Prost won the previous two races in San Marino and Spain.

programme.title: Classic F1 Races
programme.desc: Relive the Monaco Grand Prix of 1996. In an action-packed meeting, bad weather resulted in just three drivers completing the 75-lap race. Olivier Panis claimed his maiden chequered flag.

programme.title: Classic F1 Races
programme.desc: Relive the Monaco Grand Prix of 2003. In a thrilling race, less than two seconds separated the top three drivers when they crossed the finish line.

programme.title: Classic F1 Races
programme.desc: Relive the Monaco Grand Prix of 2008. Despite suffering two punctures during the race, Lewis Hamilton claimed his maiden chequered flag on the famous street circuit.

programme.title: Classic F1 Races
programme.desc: Relive the Monaco Grand Prix of 2011. With just ten laps remaining on the famous street circuit, the top three drivers were separated by less than a second.

programme.desc: Interceptor: In the garage with the crack team who build cop cars. A bad stench is emanating from a riot van. A marked Interceptor with 105,000 miles on the clock is retired.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Forensics: Another day of repairs and rebuilds at Cheshire Police's car workshop. John Heussi embarks on a complete redesign of the force's fleet of outdated forensic vans.

programme.title: Robson's Extreme Fishing Challenge
programme.desc: Brazil: The actor begins his challenges of expert fishermen from around the world to five rounds of angling to see who can catch the biggest fish in Brazil.

programme.title: Robson's Extreme Fishing Challenge
programme.desc: Michigan: The actor heads to Michigan's Great Lakes as a violent storm threatens to scupper his first challenge against a father-and-son team of muskie fishermen.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Best Of: Dani D Leader of the Pick: Danielle hits the roads and shows Mike and Frank a thing or two about picking.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Best Of: Deep Woods Pickin': Mike and Frank venture off the beaten path in hopes of finding deals and profit on the road less travelled.

programme.title: How Britain Worked
programme.desc: Guy Martin and a team from the Black Country Living Museum restore a Newcomen engine, an 18th-century steam-powered device used principally to pump water out of mines.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Paddy reveals his ultimate cheap but luxurious off-roader - the homebuilt 'Dirty Rascal' - and Chris races the 2.5m McLaren Speedtail against the RAF's newest fighter jet.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Paddy, Freddie and Chris are sent on a high-altitude mountain expedition across Peru in second-hand American cars.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: On the 'box this time: Squid Game: The Challenge, I'm a Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here!, The Crown, Deal or No Deal, Planet Earth III, Made in Chelsea and Saving Lives at Sea.

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow
programme.desc: (2004) Tense sci-fi thriller starring Dennis Quaid and Jake Gyllenhaal. A scientist sets out to save his son when global warming plunges the world into a sudden climatic catastrophe.

programme.title: The Straight Story
programme.desc: (1999) In tribute to auteur David Lynch, who died on 15 January. Singular road-trip drama about a man who crosses America on a lawnmower to visit his dying brother. With Richard Farnsworth.

programme.title: Lynch/Oz
programme.desc: (2022) In tribute to David Lynch, who died on 15 January. This aptly idiosyncratic documentary pulls back the curtain on how 1939's The Wizard of Oz influenced the visionary auteur's films.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.desc: (2017) Heart-warming family drama. During the Belfast Blitz, a young lad becomes the protector of a baby elephant. Can he and his friends save Buster from being put down?

programme.title: Dunston Checks In
programme.desc: (1996) Comedy starring Faye Dunaway and Rupert Everett. A hotel owner's attempt to upgrade her star rating is undermined by the arrival of a master thief and his light-fingered orangutan.

programme.title: Clueless
programme.desc: (1995) Classic 90s high-school re-imagining of Jane Austen's Emma. Two fashion-obsessed pals (Alicia Silverstone, Stacey Dash) transform a new girl (Brittany Murphy) but create a monster.

programme.title: The Pursuit of Happyness
programme.desc: (2006) Biographical drama starring Will Smith as Chris Gardner, the down-on-his-luck salesman who risked it all to provide a better life for himself and his son.

programme.title: Gifted
programme.desc: (2017) Tug of love drama with Chris Evans. A maths prodigy's future becomes the focus of a family custody battle. What will prevail: a regular childhood or the drive to be exceptional?

programme.title: Deadpool 2
programme.desc: (2018) Ryan Reynolds returns as the potty-mouthed, can of whup-ass opening superhero and now he's got buddies to help him take on baddie Josh Brolin in the all-out action comedy sequel.

programme.title: The Entity
programme.desc: (1982) Sidney J Furie's seminal horror stars Barbara Hershey as a divorced mother of three who becomes the victim of a poltergeist that submits her to multiple violent and sexual assaults.

programme.title: Unsane
programme.desc: (2018) Claire Foy (The Crown) stars in Steven Soderbergh's creepy thriller about a woman who is being stalked by the son of a man she cared for in his dying days. But is it all in her head?

programme.title: The Golden Child

programme.title: My Spy

programme.title: Sister Act

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts the game in which three pairs of contestants use their skills to find words from the fewest letters possible. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to potentially double the money they won earlier or leave with nothing. Crossing words with the reigning champions this time are married couple Mala and Michael, and friends Heather and Emily

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Join Stephen Mulhern as Matt gets his opportunity to open the iconic red boxes - in the game show with only one question, will Matt say 'Deal' or 'No deal' when faced with the Banker's tempting offers or choose to take home what's inside his randomly selected box instead?

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern host as the remaining nine celebrities perform routines with their professional skating partners to songs that have personal meaning to them in order to impress the judges and avoid elimination

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined by Angela Rippon and Gary Kemp and Camilla Bassett-Smith shares her favourite flowers to plant this time of year. Jekka McVicar brews some homemade 'love potions' and farmer Tom Davis demonstrates how he gets his purebred poultry competition-ready. Jaega Wise shares her favourite winter-warming beers

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined at his Hampshire home by former EastEnders star Tracy-Ann Oberman and chefs Nathan Outlaw and Paul Foster who serve up some delicious recipes of their own

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: Restaurateur Nisha Katona presents a cooking series set in the Wirral on England's west coast as she shares her passion for good food and cooks dishes inspired by her family and heritage from her own outdoor kitchen. She begins with a chicken dhansak, a green bean and mango dal bunny chow and a Hungarian family favourite of layered cabbage with paprika pork mince. Plus, an insight into what a farrier does

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The celebrated chef arrives in the south-eastern town of Annecy, where he wanders around its market to select ingredients for his first cook. On the stunning shore of its crystal clear lake, James cooks dishes showcasing delicious local tomatoes, red mullet and lobster. He then visits award-winning pastry chef Philippe Rigollot to sample some of his extraordinary creations

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v Wales (Kick-off 2.15pm). Jill Douglas presents all the action from the opening match in the second round of fixtures, held at Stadio Olimpico. The teams last met in the final round of the 2024 competition. when Italy claimed 24-21 victory at Principality Stadium. That result left Wales with the Wooden Spoon after losing all five of their matches for the first time since 2003, while the Azzurri's two victories and a draw represented their best ever showing in the Six Nations. Analysis from Dan Biggar, Jamie Roberts and Sergio Parisse, reports by Claire Thomas, and commentary from Miles Harrison, Nolli Waterman and Shane Williams

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v France (Kick-off 4.45pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from both teams' second match of the championship, held at Allianz Stadium Twickenham. France have won the last three meetings between the teams, including a narrow 33-31 victory in Lyon last year and an emphatic 53-10 triumph here in 2023, which was France's biggest-ever winning margin against England and the hosts' heaviest home defeat of all time. With analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Eddie Jones and Brian O'Driscoll, pitchside inserts by Topsy Ojo and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary from Nick Mullins, Ben Kay and Benjamin Kayser

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts as the five Masked Singers perform in the semi-final and a double elimination chooses the three finalists. Richard E Grant joins the judges panel

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: Abigail closes the trade deal with her Australian counterpart while pushing Greg behind in the race just days before the election. As the final clue reveals Sophie's killer leaving everyone shell-shocked, Meg and Max have to decide what justice looks like in this case and Max is forced to choose what he'd like his own future to look like

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, including Sunderland v Watford at Stadium of Light, West Bromwich Albion v Sheffield Wednesday at The Hawthorns and Sheffield United v Portsmouth at Bramall Lane in the Championship

programme.title: The Murder of Olly Stephens: Social Media Murders
programme.desc: Thirteen-year-old Olly Stephens was fatally stabbed just metres from his home. This documentary exposes the chilling online plot carried out by his young killers who were inspired by the glorification of knives and gang culture they found on social media. This horrific crime in an affluent part of Reading shocked a community and left Olly's devastated parents searching for answers

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: Abigail closes the trade deal with her Australian counterpart while pushing Greg behind in the race just days before the election. As the final clue reveals Sophie's killer leaving everyone shell-shocked, Meg and Max have to decide what justice looks like in this case and Max is forced to choose what he'd like his own future to look like

programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: The Royal Beat
programme.desc: Kate Thornton is joined by The Mirror's Royal Editor Russell Myers, Royal Editor for The Sunday Times Roya Nikkhah and Royal Journalist for ITV News Lizzie Robinson to discuss all of the latest news surrounding the royal family

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts as the five Masked Singers perform in the semi-final and a double elimination chooses the three finalists. Richard E Grant joins the judges panel

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined by comedian, author and QI favourite Alan Davies along with award-winning star of stage and screen Frances Barber. Camilla Bassett-Smith opens up her February diary with some fragrant flowers that are perfect for planting this time of year, pottery-pro Princess Fingall gives a masterclass in clay, and Jonathan Phang ends the show with his top picks for Valentine's Day drinks and nibbles in a romantic Best of British brunch

programme.title: Fletchers' Family Farm
programme.desc: The Fletchers focus on diversification at the farm as Kelvin forages for berries and herbs to make their very own Fletchers' gin. Liz is feeling inspired by leftover sheep's wool and heads to a mill in Oldham to see if they can be made into blankets and Marnie and Milo retrieve their wildlife cameras to log the multiple species they see in their woods. Ruby the cow finally turns a corner and lets her calf drink from her after struggling to bond with her

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: Restaurateur Nisha Katona presents a cooking series set in the Wirral on England's west coast as she shares her passion for good food and cooks dishes inspired by her family and heritage from her own outdoor kitchen. She begins with a chicken dhansak, a green bean and mango dal bunny chow and a Hungarian family favourite of layered cabbage with paprika pork mince. Plus, an insight into what a farrier does

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Pictionary
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts the game show where two teams of three players compete against each other trying to guess the correct word or phrase represented by the drawings of their team-mates. Mel is joined by Denise Van Outen and Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen as the players draw and their team members guess

programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Plymouth Argyle v Liverpool (Kick-off 3.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the fourth-round tie at Home Park. Championship strugglers Plymouth claimed a shock 1-0 away win against Brentford in the previous round and are now looking for an even bigger upset. The Reds have been in fine form in all competitions this term and will be looking to emulate their last FA Cup triumph three seasons ago after prevailing 4-0 at home to Accrington Stanley in round three. With analysis from Robbie Fowler and Karen Carney, commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon, and reports from Gabriel Clarke

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: As the competition heats up, the bottom two couples battle it out on the ice, performing once more to impress the judges and avoid elimination

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts a celebrity version of the big-prize quiz in which Julie Hesmondhalgh and Tony Bellew answer questions to win cash for their chosen charities. With lifelines including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: When a spine is dredged out of Whitney Marsh, a new case begins for Jess and Sunny's team at Bishop Street CID with four potential suspects. Juliet, Melinda, Asif and Marty each have secrets to hide, but both Jess and Sunny are glad of a new challenge given their strained personal lives. Return of the crime drama, starring Sanjeev Bhaskar and Sinéad Keenan

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Bradley & Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The actor and his son hit the road together again, but this time they are staying closer to home and heading for Europe as they travel from Essex to Italy's Amalfi coast. Their first stop is the Netherlands, where they try out the sport of canal jumping, before the pair don Lycra for a spot of velodrome track cycling alongside a world champion, and take on the world's tallest freestanding climbing wall

programme.title: Super Bowl LIX Live
programme.desc: Kansas City Chiefs v Philadelphia Eagles (Kick-off 11.30pm). Coverage of the showpiece match which takes place at Caesars Superdome in New Orleans, Louisiana. The Chiefs are looking to become the first team to win three consecutive Super Bowls after they beat the Buffalo Bills 32-29 in the AFC Championship match. The Eagles hammered the Washington Commanders 55-23 in the NFC Championship match to reach their third Super Bowl in eight years. Craig Doyle presents, with analysis from Efe Obada, Osi Umenyiora and Jason Bell. Rapper Kendrick Lamar provides the entertainment for the half-time show

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v Wales (Kick-off 2.15pm). Jill Douglas presents all the action from the opening match in the second round of fixtures, held at Stadio Olimpico. The teams last met in the final round of the 2024 competition. when Italy claimed 24-21 victory at Principality Stadium. That result left Wales with the Wooden Spoon after losing all five of their matches for the first time since 2003, while the Azzurri's two victories and a draw represented their best ever showing in the Six Nations. Analysis from Dan Biggar, Jamie Roberts and Sergio Parisse, reports by Claire Thomas, and commentary from Miles Harrison, Nolli Waterman and Shane Williams

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v France (Kick-off 4.45pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from both teams' second match of the championship, held at Allianz Stadium Twickenham. France have won the last three meetings between the teams, including a narrow 33-31 victory in Lyon last year and an emphatic 53-10 triumph here in 2023, which was France's biggest-ever winning margin against England and the hosts' heaviest home defeat of all time. With analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Eddie Jones and Brian O'Driscoll, pitchside inserts by Topsy Ojo and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary from Nick Mullins, Ben Kay and Benjamin Kayser

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts as the five Masked Singers perform in the semi-final and a double elimination chooses the three finalists. Richard E Grant joins the judges panel

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: Abigail closes the trade deal with her Australian counterpart while pushing Greg behind in the race just days before the election. As the final clue reveals Sophie's killer leaving everyone shell-shocked, Meg and Max have to decide what justice looks like in this case and Max is forced to choose what he'd like his own future to look like

programme.title: The Murder of Olly Stephens: Social Media Murders
programme.desc: Thirteen-year-old Olly Stephens was fatally stabbed just metres from his home. This documentary exposes the chilling online plot carried out by his young killers who were inspired by the glorification of knives and gang culture they found on social media. This horrific crime in an affluent part of Reading shocked a community and left Olly's devastated parents searching for answers

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined by comedian, author and QI favourite Alan Davies along with award-winning star of stage and screen Frances Barber. Camilla Bassett-Smith opens up her February diary with some fragrant flowers that are perfect for planting this time of year, pottery-pro Princess Fingall gives a masterclass in clay, and Jonathan Phang ends the show with his top picks for Valentine's Day drinks and nibbles in a romantic Best of British brunch

programme.title: Fletchers' Family Farm
programme.desc: The Fletchers focus on diversification at the farm as Kelvin forages for berries and herbs to make their very own Fletchers' gin. Liz is feeling inspired by leftover sheep's wool and heads to a mill in Oldham to see if they can be made into blankets and Marnie and Milo retrieve their wildlife cameras to log the multiple species they see in their woods. Ruby the cow finally turns a corner and lets her calf drink from her after struggling to bond with her

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: Restaurateur Nisha Katona presents a cooking series set in the Wirral on England's west coast as she shares her passion for good food and cooks dishes inspired by her family and heritage from her own outdoor kitchen. She begins with a chicken dhansak, a green bean and mango dal bunny chow and a Hungarian family favourite of layered cabbage with paprika pork mince. Plus, an insight into what a farrier does

programme.title: Pictionary
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts the game show where two teams of three players compete against each other trying to guess the correct word or phrase represented by the drawings of their team-mates. Mel is joined by Denise Van Outen and Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen as the players draw and their team members guess

programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Plymouth Argyle v Liverpool (Kick-off 3.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the fourth-round tie at Home Park. Championship strugglers Plymouth claimed a shock 1-0 away win against Brentford in the previous round and are now looking for an even bigger upset. The Reds have been in fine form in all competitions this term and will be looking to emulate their last FA Cup triumph three seasons ago after prevailing 4-0 at home to Accrington Stanley in round three. With analysis from Robbie Fowler and Karen Carney, commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon, and reports from Gabriel Clarke

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.desc: As the competition heats up, the bottom two couples battle it out on the ice, performing once more to impress the judges and avoid elimination

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts a celebrity version of the big-prize quiz in which Julie Hesmondhalgh and Tony Bellew answer questions to win cash for their chosen charities. With lifelines including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: When a spine is dredged out of Whitney Marsh, a new case begins for Jess and Sunny's team at Bishop Street CID with four potential suspects. Juliet, Melinda, Asif and Marty each have secrets to hide, but both Jess and Sunny are glad of a new challenge given their strained personal lives. Return of the crime drama, starring Sanjeev Bhaskar and Sinéad Keenan

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Bradley & Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The actor and his son hit the road together again, but this time they are staying closer to home and heading for Europe as they travel from Essex to Italy's Amalfi coast. Their first stop is the Netherlands, where they try out the sport of canal jumping, before the pair don Lycra for a spot of velodrome track cycling alongside a world champion, and take on the world's tallest freestanding climbing wall

programme.title: Super Bowl LIX Live
programme.desc: Kansas City Chiefs v Philadelphia Eagles (Kick-off 11.30pm). Coverage of the showpiece match which takes place at Caesars Superdome in New Orleans, Louisiana. The Chiefs are looking to become the first team to win three consecutive Super Bowls after they beat the Buffalo Bills 32-29 in the AFC Championship match. The Eagles hammered the Washington Commanders 55-23 in the NFC Championship match to reach their third Super Bowl in eight years. Craig Doyle presents, with analysis from Efe Obada, Osi Umenyiora and Jason Bell. Rapper Kendrick Lamar provides the entertainment for the half-time show

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The celebrated chef arrives in the south-eastern town of Annecy, where he wanders around its market to select ingredients for his first cook. He then visits award-winning pastry chef Philippe Rigollot to sample some of his extraordinary creations

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v Wales (Kick-off 2.15pm). Jill Douglas presents all the action from the opening match in the second round of fixtures, held at Stadio Olimpico. The teams last met in the final round of the 2024 competition. when Italy claimed 24-21 victory at Principality Stadium. That result left Wales with the Wooden Spoon after losing all five of their matches for the first time since 2003, while the Azzurri's two victories and a draw represented their best ever showing in the Six Nations. Analysis from Dan Biggar, Jamie Roberts and Sergio Parisse, reports by Claire Thomas, and commentary from Miles Harrison, Nolli Waterman and Shane Williams

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v France (Kick-off 4.45pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from both teams' second match of the championship, held at Allianz Stadium Twickenham. France have won the last three meetings between the teams, including a narrow 33-31 victory in Lyon last year and an emphatic 53-10 triumph here in 2023, which was France's biggest-ever winning margin against England and the hosts' heaviest home defeat of all time. With analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Eddie Jones and Brian O'Driscoll, pitchside inserts by Topsy Ojo and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary from Nick Mullins, Ben Kay and Benjamin Kayser

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts as the five Masked Singers perform in the semi-final and a double elimination chooses the three finalists. Richard E Grant joins the judges panel

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: Abigail closes the trade deal with her Australian counterpart while pushing Greg behind in the race just days before the election. programme.title: The Murder of Olly Stephens: Social Media Murders
programme.desc: Thirteen-year-old Olly Stephens was fatally stabbed just metres from his home. This documentary exposes the chilling online plot carried out by his young killers who were inspired by the glorification of knives and gang culture they found on social media. This horrific crime in an affluent part of Reading shocked a community and left Olly's devastated parents searching for answers

programme.title: Fletchers' Family Farm
programme.desc: The Fletchers focus on diversification at the farm as Kelvin forages for berries and herbs to make their very own Fletchers' gin. Liz is feeling inspired by leftover sheep's wool and heads to a mill in Oldham to see if they can be made into blankets and Marnie and Milo retrieve their wildlife cameras to log the multiple species they see in their woods. Ruby the cow finally turns a corner and lets her calf drink from her after struggling to bond with her

programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Plymouth Argyle v Liverpool (Kick-off 3.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the fourth-round tie at Home Park. Championship strugglers Plymouth claimed a shock 1-0 away win against Brentford in the previous round and are now looking for an even bigger upset. The Reds have been in fine form in all competitions this term and will be looking to emulate their last FA Cup triumph three seasons ago after prevailing 4-0 at home to Accrington Stanley in round three. With analysis from Robbie Fowler and Karen Carney, commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon, and reports from Gabriel Clarke

programme.title: Bradley & Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The actor and his son hit the road together again, but this time they are staying closer to home and heading for Europe as they travel from Essex to Italy's Amalfi coast. Their first stop is the Netherlands, where they try out the sport of canal jumping, before the pair don Lycra for a spot of velodrome track cycling alongside a world champion, and take on the world's tallest freestanding climbing wall

programme.title: Super Bowl LIX Live
programme.desc: Kansas City Chiefs v Philadelphia Eagles (Kick-off 11.30pm). Coverage of the showpiece match which takes place at Caesars Superdome in New Orleans, Louisiana. The Chiefs are looking to become the first team to win three consecutive Super Bowls after they beat the Buffalo Bills 32-29 in the AFC Championship match. The Eagles hammered the Washington Commanders 55-23 in the NFC Championship match to reach their third Super Bowl in eight years. Craig Doyle presents, with analysis from Efe Obada, Osi Umenyiora and Jason Bell. Rapper Kendrick Lamar provides the entertainment for the half-time show
